item.title: Quality Assurance Project Manager (san jose north)
item.description:
Quality Assurance Project Manager

The Opportunity:

SteepRock (http://www.steeprockinc.com/node/2) is a young, successful software and services firm with a unique approach to important bio-pharmaceutical industry issues on an enterprise scale. SteepRock has an immediate opening for experienced software QA project managers to work on cutting-edge Web and Windows-based software. Successful candidates will combine hands-on testing skills with the ability to structure small projects for other testers and development staff, and manage them to completion  typically a month or less in duration. Successful candidates will NOT say Knowledge of SDLC on their replies; instead, they will tell us how they solved a problem, hit a deadline, satisfied a client, and/or made their company some money.

This position allows employees to work from their home office full-time with medical insurance and IRA plan benefits. We have employees throughout the continental U.S. SteepRock compensates necessary phone and connectivity expenses. This is a fast-paced, challenging job with hard work and near-term. Expect night and weekend work to meet client deadlines. No travel.

Requirements:

 Hands-on, software quality assurance professional, with a proven track record of delivering high quality systems, and the desire to do so repeatedly;
 Experience defining, documenting, and executing primarily black box testing efforts  including the ability to create test plans with detailed test cases guided by the inherent ability to understand the application and requirements in depth;
 Experience as a test lead or project manager on small projects
 Experience testing database and database centric applications using Structured Query Language and enterprise databases (especially MS SQL Server, MySQL);
 Excellent English written and verbal communications skills absolutely essential;
 Mastery of Microsoft Office applications;
 Testing experience with Internet and web technologies including HTML, JavaScript, XML, XSL, LAMP;
 Detailed knowledge of QA Tools and methodologies;
 Knowledge of source code control and project management applications and disciplines;
 Experience with Linux/Unix servers a plus;
 Ability to read and understand Python source code a plus;
 BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent;
 U.S. citizenship or permanent work visa and,
 At least 5 years direct experience with Software Quality Assurance.

Interested candidates please email resume and salary requirements with subject QA Project Manager.

No headhunters or contractors will be accepted.
